intro: Talisia floresii, commonly known as the Flores talisia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Talisia floresii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
